aura:renderIf.description: Deprecated. Use aura:if instead. This component allows you to conditionally render its contents. It renders its body only if isTrue evaluates to true. The else attribute allows you to render an alternative when isTrue evaluates to false.

attributes.description: Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name for the button element. This value is optional and can be used to identify the button in a callback.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value for the button element. This value is optional and can be used when submitting a form.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The text to be displayed inside the button.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description: The variant changes the appearance of the button. Accepted variants include base, neutral, brand, destructive, inverse and success. This value defaults to neutral.

attributes.name: iconName
attributes.description: The Lightning Design System name of the icon. Names are written in the format 'utility:down' where 'utility' is the category, and 'down' is the specific icon to be displayed.

attributes.name: iconPosition
attributes.description: Describes the position of the icon with respect to body. Options include left and right. This value defaults to left.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Specifies whether this button should be displayed in a disabled state. Disabled buttons can't be clicked. This value defaults to false.

attributes.name: onclick
attributes.description: The action triggered when the button is clicked.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Specifies the type of button. Valid values are button, reset, and submit. This value defaults to button.

attributes.name: ariaLabel
attributes.description: Label describing the button to assistive technologies.

attributes.name: ariaDescribedBy
attributes.description: A space-separated list of element IDs that provides descriptive labels for the button.

attributes.name: ariaControls
attributes.description: A space-separated list of element IDs that this button controls the contents or presence of.

attributes.name: ariaExpanded
attributes.description: Indicates whether an element the button controls is expanded or collapsed. Valid values are 'true' or 'false'.

attributes.name: ariaLive
attributes.description: Indicates that the button will be updated. Valid values are 'assertive', 'polite', or 'off'.

attributes.name: ariaAtomic
attributes.description: Indicates whether assistive technologies will present all, or only parts of, the changed region. Valid values are 'true' or 'false'.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Specifies the name of an input element.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Specifies the value of an input element.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description: The variant changes the appearance of an input field. Accepted variants include standard and label-hidden. This value defaults to standard.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Specifies that an input element should be disabled. This value defaults to false.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Specifies that an input field is read-only. This value defaults to false.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Specifies that an input field must be filled out before submitting the form. This value defaults to false.

attributes.name: validity
attributes.description: Represents the validity states that an element can be in, with respect to constraint validation.

attributes.name: onchange
attributes.description: The action triggered when a value attribute changes.

attributes.name: accesskey
attributes.description: Specifies a shortcut key to activate or focus an element.

attributes.name: tabindex
attributes.description: Specifies the tab order of an element (when the tab button is used for navigating).

attributes.name: onfocus
attributes.description: The action triggered when the element receives focus.

attributes.name: onblur
attributes.description: The action triggered when the element releases focus.

attributes.name: class
attributes.description: A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of the input. This value defaults to text.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Text label for the input.

attributes.name: formatter
attributes.description: String value with the formatter to be used for number input. Valid values include decimal, percent, percent-fixed, and currency.

attributes.name: files
attributes.description: A FileList that contains selected files. This attribute can be used only when type='file'.

attributes.name: isLoading
attributes.description: Specifies whether the spinner is displayed to indicate that data is loading. This value defaults to false.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: Text that is displayed when the field is empty, to prompt the user for a valid entry.

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: The maximum number of characters allowed in the field.

attributes.name: minlength
attributes.description: The minimum number of characters allowed in the field.

attributes.name: pattern
attributes.description: Specifies the regular expression that the input's value is checked against.                                 This attribute is supported for text, search, url, tel, email, and password types.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The maximum acceptable value for the input. This attribute can be used only with number, range, date, time, and datetime input types. For number and range type, the max value is a decimal number. For the date, time, and datetime types, the max value must use a valid string for the type.

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: The minimum acceptable value for the input. This attribute can be used only with number, range, date, time, and datetime input types. For number and range types, the min value is a decimal number. For the date, time, and datetime types, the min value must use a valid string for the type.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description: Granularity of the value, specified as a positive floating point number. Use 'any' when granularity is not a concern. This value defaults to 1.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Specifies whether the checkbox is checked. This value defaults to false.

attributes.name: timezone
attributes.description: Specifies the time zone used when type='datetime' only. This value defaults to the user’s Salesforce time zone setting.

attributes.name: accept
attributes.description: Specifies the types of files that the server accepts. This attribute can be used only when type='file'.

attributes.name: multiple
attributes.description: Specifies that a user can enter more than one value. This attribute can be used only when type='file' or type='email'.

attributes.name: messageWhenBadInput
attributes.description: Error message to be displayed when a bad input is detected.

attributes.name: messageWhenPatternMismatch
attributes.description: Error message to be displayed when a pattern mismatch is detected.

attributes.name: messageWhenTypeMismatch
attributes.description: Error message to be displayed when a type mismatch is detected.

attributes.name: messageWhenValueMissing
attributes.description: Error message to be displayed when the value is missing.

attributes.name: messageWhenRangeOverflow
attributes.description: Error message to be displayed when a range overflow is detected.

attributes.name: messageWhenRangeUnderflow
attributes.description: Error message to be displayed when a range underflow is detected.

attributes.name: messageWhenStepMismatch
attributes.description: Error message to be displayed when a step mismatch is detected.

attributes.name: messageWhenTooLong
attributes.description: Error message to be displayed when the value is too long.

attributes.name: messageWhenTooShort
attributes.description: Error message to be displayed when the value is too short.

attributes.name: messageToggleActive
attributes.description: Text shown for the active state of a toggle. The default is "Active".

attributes.name: messageToggleInactive
attributes.description: Text shown for then inactive state of a toggle. The default is "Inactive".

attributes.name: ariaLabel
attributes.description: Describes the input to assistive technologies.

attributes.name: ariaLabelledBy
attributes.description: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide labels for the input.

attributes.name: ariaDescribedBy
attributes.description: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide descriptive labels for the input.

attributes.name: ariaControls
attributes.description: A space-separated list of element IDs whose presence or content is controlled by the input.

attributes.name: timeAriaLabel
attributes.description: Describes the time input to assistive technologies when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this label is merged with ariaLabel and dateAriaLabel to describe the native date time input.

attributes.name: timeAriaLabelledBy
attributes.description: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide labels for the time input when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this is merged with ariaLabelledBy and dateAriaLabelledBy to describe the native date time input.

attributes.name: timeAriaDescribedBy
attributes.description: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide descriptive labels for the time input when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this is merged with ariaDescribedBy and dateAriaDescribedBy to describe the native date time input.

attributes.name: timeAriaControls
attributes.description: A space-separated list of element IDs whose presence or content is controlled by the time input when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this is merged with ariaControls and dateAriaControls to describe the native date time input.

attributes.name: dateAriaLabel
attributes.description: Describes the date input to assistive technologies when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this label is merged with ariaLabel and timeAriaLabel to describe the native date time input.

attributes.name: dateAriaLabelledBy
attributes.description: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide labels for the date input when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this is merged with ariaLabelledBy and timeAriaLabelledBy to describe the native date time input.

attributes.name: dateAriaDescribedBy
attributes.description: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide descriptive labels for the date input when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this is merged with ariaDescribedBy and timeAriaDescribedBy to describe the native date time input.

attributes.name: dateAriaControls
attributes.description: A space-separated list of element IDs whose presence or content is controlled by the date input when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this is merged with ariaControls and timeAriaControls to describe the native date time input.

attributes.name: key

attributes.name: mode

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The toast type, which can be 'error', 'warning', 'success', or 'info'. The default is 'other', which is styled like an 'info' toast and doesn’t display an icon, unless specified by the key attribute.

attributes.description: If the viewport is divided into 12 parts, size indicates the relative space the container occupies. Size is expressed as an integer from 1 through 12. This applies for all device-types.

attributes.name: smallDeviceSize
attributes.description: If the viewport is divided into 12 parts, this attribute indicates the relative space the container occupies on device-types larger than mobile. It is expressed as an integer from 1 through 12.

attributes.name: mediumDeviceSize
attributes.description: If the viewport is divided into 12 parts, this attribute indicates the relative space the container occupies on device-types larger than tablet. It is expressed as an integer from 1 through 12.

attributes.name: largeDeviceSize
attributes.description: If the viewport is divided into 12 parts, this attribute indicates the relative space the container occupies on device-types larger than desktop. It is expressed as an integer from 1 through 12.

attributes.name: flexibility
attributes.description: Make the item fluid so that it absorbs any extra space in its container or shrinks when there is less space. Allowed values are: auto (columns grow or shrink equally as space allows), shrink (columns shrink equally as space decreases), no-shrink (columns don't shrink as space reduces), grow (columns grow equally as space increases), no-grow (columns don't grow as space increases), no-flex (columns don't grow or shrink as space changes). Use a comma-separated value for multiple options, such as 'auto, no-shrink'.

attributes.name: padding
attributes.description: Sets padding to either the right and left sides of a container, or all sides of a container. Allowed values are horizontal-small, horizontal-medium, horizontal-large, around-small, around-medium, around-large.

attributes.name: alignmentBump
attributes.description: Specifies a direction to bump the alignment of adjacent layout items. Allowed values are left, top, right, bottom.

attributes.name: UID

attributes.description: Determines how to spread the layout items vertically. The alignment options are start, center, end, and stretch.

attributes.name: body
attributes.description: The body of the component. In markup, this is everything in the body of the tag.

attributes.description: Id of the current entity in the context of which the component is being displayed.

attributes.name: dashboardId
attributes.description: The unique ID of the dashboard. You can get a dashboard’s ID, an 18-character code beginning with 0FK, from the dashboard's URL, or you can request it through the API. This attribute can be used instead of the developer name, but it can't be included if the name has been set. One of the two is required.

attributes.name: developerName
attributes.description: The unique developer name of the dashboard. You can request the developer name through the API. This attribute can be used instead of the dashboard ID, but it can't be included if the ID has been set. One of the two is required.

attributes.name: hideOnError
attributes.description: Controls whether or not users see a dashboard that has an error. When this attribute is set to true, if the dashboard has an error, it won’t appear on the page. When set to false, the dashboard appears but doesn’t show any data. An error can occur when a user doesn't have access to the dashboard or it has been deleted.

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: Specifies the height of the dashboard, in pixels.

attributes.name: showSharing
attributes.description: If true, and the dashboard is shareable, then the dashboard shows the Share icon. If false, the dashboard doesn't show the Share icon. To show the Share icon in the dashboard, the smallest supported frame size is 800 x 612 pixels.

attributes.name: showTitle
attributes.description: If true, the dashboard’s title is included above the dashboard. If false, the dashboard appears without a title.

attributes.name: showHeader
attributes.description: If true, the dashboard is displayed with a header bar that includes dashboard information and controls. If false, the dashboard appears without a header bar. Note that the header bar automatically appears when either showSharing or showTitle is true.

attributes.name: rendered
attributes.description: Specifies whether or not the component is rendered on the page.

attributes.name: filter
attributes.description: Adds selections or filters to the embedded dashboard at runtime. The filter attribute is configured using JSON. For filtering by dimension, use this syntax: {'datasets' : {'dataset1': [ {'fields': ['field1'], 'selection': ['$value1', '$value2']}, {'fields': ['field2'], 'filter': { 'operator': 'operator1', 'values': ['$value3', '$value4']}}]}}. For filtering on measures, use this syntax: {'datasets' : {'dataset1': [ {'fields': ['field1'], 'selection': ['$value1', '$value2']}, {'fields': ['field2'], 'filter': { 'operator': 'operator1', 'values': [[$value3]]}}]}}. With the selection option, the dashboard is shown with all its data, and the specified dimension values are highlighted. With the filter option, the dashboard is shown with only filtered data. For more information, see https://help.salesforce.com/articleView?id=bi_embed_community_builder.htm.

attributes.name: openLinksInNewWindow
attributes.description: If false, links to other dashboards will be opened in the same window.

attributes.name: accessToken
attributes.description: A valid access token obtained by logging into Salesforce. Useful when the component is used by Lightning Out in a non-Salesforce domain.

attributes.name: dashboardId
attributes.description: The unique ID of the dashboard. You can get a dashboard’s ID, an 18-character code beginning with 0FK, from the dashboard's URL, or you can request it through the API. This attribute can be used instead of the developer name, but it can't be included if the name has been set. One of the two is required.

attributes.name: developerName
attributes.description: The unique developer name of the dashboard. You can request the developer name through the API. This attribute can be used instead of the dashboard ID, but it can't be included if the ID has been set. One of the two is required.

attributes.name: hideOnError
attributes.description: Controls whether or not users see a dashboard that has an error. When this attribute is set to true, if the dashboard has an error, it won’t appear on the page. When set to false, the dashboard appears but doesn’t show any data. An error can occur when a user doesn't have access to the dashboard or it has been deleted.

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: Specifies the height of the dashboard, in pixels.

attributes.name: showSharing
attributes.description: If true, and the dashboard is shareable, then the dashboard shows the Share icon. If false, the dashboard doesn't show the Share icon. To show the Share icon in the dashboard, the smallest supported frame size is 800 x 612 pixels.

attributes.name: showTitle
attributes.description: If true, the dashboard’s title is included above the dashboard. If false, the dashboard appears without a title.

attributes.name: showHeader
attributes.description: If true, the dashboard is displayed with a header bar that includes dashboard information and controls. If false, the dashboard appears without a header bar. Note that the header bar automatically appears when either showSharing or showTitle is true.

attributes.name: rendered
attributes.description: Specifies whether or not the component is rendered on the page.

attributes.name: filter
attributes.description: Adds selections or filters to the embedded dashboard at runtime. The filter attribute is configured using JSON. For filtering by dimension, use this syntax: {'datasets' : {'dataset1': [ {'fields': ['field1'], 'selection': ['$value1', '$value2']}, {'fields': ['field2'], 'filter': { 'operator': 'operator1', 'values': ['$value3', '$value4']}}]}}. For filtering on measures, use this syntax: {'datasets' : {'dataset1': [ {'fields': ['field1'], 'selection': ['$value1', '$value2']}, {'fields': ['field2'], 'filter': { 'operator': 'operator1', 'values': [[$value3]]}}]}}. With the selection option, the dashboard is shown with all its data, and the specified dimension values are highlighted. With the filter option, the dashboard is shown with only filtered data. For more information, see https://help.salesforce.com/articleView?id=bi_embed_lightning.htm.

attributes.name: openLinksInNewWindow

It's intended for outputting pre-formatted HTML, for example, where the formatting is arbitrary, or expensive to calculate. The body of this component is ignored, and won't be rendered. Warning: this component outputs value as unescaped HTML, which introduces the possibility of security vulnerabilities in your code. You must sanitize user input before rendering it unescaped, or you will create a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability. Only use <aura:unescapedHtml> with trusted or sanitized sources of data.

attributes.description: Specifies whether column resizing is disabled. The default is false.

attributes.description: Specifies whether the inline edit Save/Cancel bottom bar should be hidden.

attributes.description: The minimum width for all columns. The default is 50px.

attributes.description: The maximum width for all columns. The default is 1000px.

attributes.name: resizeStep
attributes.description: The width to resize the column when user press left or right arrow. The default is 10px.

attributes.description: The column fieldName that controls the sorting order. Sort the data using the onsort event handler.

attributes.name: sortedDirection
attributes.description: Specifies the sorting direction. Sort the data using the onsort event handler. Valid options include 'asc' and 'desc'.

attributes.name: defaultSortDirection
attributes.description: Specifies the default sorting direction on an unsorted column. Valid options include 'asc' and 'desc'. The default is 'asc' for sorting in ascending order.

attributes.name: showRowNumberColumn
attributes.description: Shows or hides the row number column. Set to true to show the row number column. The default is false.

attributes.name: rowNumberOffset
attributes.description: Determines where to start counting the row number. The default is 0.

attributes.name: enableInfiniteLoading
attributes.description: Enables or disables infinite loading. The default is false.

attributes.name: loadMoreOffset
attributes.description: Determines when to trigger infinite loading based on how many pixels the table's scroll position is from the bottom of the table. The default is 20.

attributes.name: isLoading
attributes.description: Specifies whether more data is being loaded and displays a spinner if so. The default is false.

attributes.name: maxRowSelection
attributes.description: The maximum number of rows that can be selected. Checkboxes are used for selection by default, and radio buttons are used when maxRowSelection is 1.

attributes.name: selectedRows
attributes.description: Enables programmatic row selection with a list of keyField values.

attributes.name: errors
attributes.description: Specifies an object containing information about cell level, row level, and table level errors. When it's set, error messages are displayed on the table accordingly.

attributes.name: draftValues

attributes.name: onloadmore
attributes.description: The action triggered when infinite loading loads more data.

attributes.description: The action triggered when a row is selected. Returns the selectedRows object.

attributes.description: The action triggered when a column is sorted. Returns fieldName and sortDirection.

attributes.description: The action triggered when a header action is clicked. By default, it also closes the header actions menu. Returns the action and columnDefinition objects.

attributes.name: onrowaction
attributes.description: The action triggered when a row action is clicked. By default, it also closes the row actions menu. Returns the eventDetails object.

attributes.name: onresize
attributes.description: The action triggered when the table renders columns the first time and every time its resized an specific column. Returns columnWidths.

attributes.name: onsave
attributes.description: The action triggered when clicking on the table footer bar's save button during inline edit. Returns the draftValues object.

attributes.name: oncancel
attributes.description: The action triggered when clicking on the table footer bar's cancel button during inline edit. All edited cells are reverted to their original values.
